summary: The Mom and Pop Tax Relief Act (H.R. 3249) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the qualified business income deduction (Section 199A). Key changes include limiting the deduction to the lesser of the taxpayer's qualified business income or $25,000, and establishing an adjusted gross income limitation. The bill makes several conforming amendments and simplifies loss carryover provisions. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
